page.title: 03T.H.E.C. ESPIN
page.content: Thomas Henry Espinall Compton Espin was vicar of Tow Law, Co. Durham, from 1888 until his death in 1934, aged 76. He composed hymns and a setting of the Communion Service. {A keen amateur astronomer and Fellow {of the Royal Astronomical Society, {Rev. Espin, helped by his assistant {Mr Milburn, discovered a total of {2,575 double stars and about 3,800 red {stars from his observatory in the {vicarage garden. In 1970 a mountain on the far side of the moon was named in his memory. {Rev. Espin also took some of the {earliest x-rays with his own machine, {set up a T.B. sanatorium in the {garden, examined the radioactive {properties of spring waters and was {very interested in rocks, fossils, {mosses and lichens.
